newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia sugar refiners at 50-60 pct capacity-agency.
newsitem.headline: Russia sugar refiners at 50-60 pct capacity-agency.

text.p: Russian sugar refineries are working at between 50 and 60 percent of capacity due to an oversupply of white sugar in Russia, Interfax news agency quoted an industry official as saying on Monday.
The unnamed official, from the Sakhar sugar producers' union, said white sugar imports in the first 10 months of the year totalled 1.3 million tonnes, mostly from Ukraine.
Ukraine sold the sugar at prices below those prevailing for whites refined in Russia from the domestic beet crop, the official said.
He called for the introduction of a quota for white sugar imports, and for raw sugar imports to be increased to 3.5 million tonnes a year in order to save the domestic sugar refining industry.
Trade sources and industry officials had said earlier that Russia would import 2.5 million tonnes of raws in 1996.
An annual quota of 1.5 million tonnes of white sugar, including 1.1 million tonnes from Ukraine is now being considered by the Russian government.
Annual consumption in Russia is about five million tonnes of whites.
